original_title: Proof that find + mkdir are Turing-Complete
original_content:
Data manipulation is at the heart of computation, and a system is said to be Turing-complete if it can be configured to manipulate data in a way that makes implementing arbitrary computation possible. [Keigo Oka] shared a proof that find and mkdir together are Turing-complete, which is to say, a system with only GNUs find and mkdir has access to enough functionality to satisfy the requirements of Turing completeness, which ignores questions of efficiency or speed.
[Keigo Oka]s first attempt at a proof worked to implement Rule 110, an elementary cellular automata configuration that has been shown to be Turing-complete, or universal, but has been updated to implement a tag system as its proof, and you can see it in action for yourself.
Seeing basic utilities leveraged in such a way illustrates how computation is all around us, and not always in expected places. Weve also seen Turing-complete origami and computation in cellular automata.
title: GNUs FindとMkdirでTuring完全性の証明
body: データ操作は計算の中心であり、チューリング完全性は任意の計算を実装できるようにデータを操作できるかどうかを指します。[Keigo Oka] はfindとmkdirだけでTuring完全性を示す証拠を共有しました。基本的なユーティリティを使った計算の例は、計算が予想外の場所で行われることを示しています。
